author: Elena Pike
comment: During my free trial the app stopped twice. Once when I was halfway the second session, so I had to start all over; and another time at the last walk of W2D1. This really put me off progressing to a paid version. Will be looking for a different app.

author: TMIx
comment: It is a great program. I have a few of the apps they have and they are all great. I do not ise the tracking distance since it does not seem to track correctly, could be due to the constant cloud cover over my area. I also don't use gear so I cannot vouch for that aspect of the apps, though it does say it supports at least a few.  Being a former Marine coming off an injury they have helped me rehab nicely. Used these in the past to get me ready and stay ready for fitness tests. Only complaint is that now each one is pay to use and I can't do a bundle price. Is that something coming in the near future?

An excellent app; keeps instructions to a minimum and just a tiny bit of encouragement at the right moments. You can keep repeating a stage if you don't feel ready to move on, and the data on each run is brilliant.

I love this app, a friend recommended it, I wasn't intending to start running but the ease of it using this app and my friends inspired me. I am at the beginning and it is not easy for me but not too hard that I want to quit. My only issue is, it says there is a music icon so I can listen to music but I can't find it. Give it a try.

author: Marianne Boisvert
comment: I began the program two days ago. As I am unfit, the first session pushed me just enough. It is motivating and well-planned. I definitely felt the burn the day after and left me looking forward to the next run!

author: Joe Ragusi
comment: Considering I haven't taken care of myself in... ever, I've figured; when better than now to start running. 5K Runner is just what I needed to get started, I really feel as though I'm getting precisely the right cardio workout for my current fitness level.

author: Julia Jael Smith
comment: The functionality of this app is just what I would expect and hope for in a couch to 5k running app, so no complaints there. However, after 5 sessions I was promoted to pay $5 to continue with the program, although there was no mention of this up front. I think the app is worth $5, but it's dishonest and sneaky to advertise the app as free without any indication that the user will be unable to follow through on the training plan without payment!! Not a fan.

Stopped running after I got injured.. this app has really helped me get back into running by following the intervals.  Finally got back to running the 2 miles... working to get the 5k! Great app.. thanks!

author: William Nix
comment: This app is fast, clean, and gets the job done without any crazy hoops. Other apps are sluggish and buggy, and I've bought a few. This was worth the few bucks I paid for it. Thanks for a great app, devs!

author: Craig Crosby-Mckenna
comment: It's a straightforward app and the routine is well paced but it's pretty basic compared to others I've used. I'd like to see a way to backup your runs, in case of getting a new phone or resetting it, I lost 4 weeks of data. Some sort of speed/ pace measurement would be good too.

author: Symantha Brott
comment: Pretty upset it doesn't tell you, you can't do all of the training unless you pay for the app. It lets you go to week 2 day 1 then you have to pay 2.99 to continue. They need to be up front about it.

author: awsome armadilo 123
comment: Great running guide. Couch to 5k. Intervals of running and walking, getting progressively tougher each week. The free trial last a couple of weeks so you can see if you like it fbefore paying. My 11 year old and I are definitely feeling fitter 4 weeks in.

author: Sage
comment: Good app. Though summary fails to tell you that you need to spend money for the compete training guide. Misleading.

author: David H
comment: I like it, always did cardio , boxing,  jump rope, burpees.  Just not a running person.  Boring,  but this app helps keep me motivated to run.

author: johnsonm0214
comment: Just finished my third day running with this app. I love that it paces me just right. Maybe someday soon i can join my first marathon. I just wish it shows your average statistics; like mile/minute, pace, etc.

author: Len Spence
comment: Bought this because C25K Pro kept crashing on my phone with nothing being done by the developers on that app, this better not let me down because I've paid for it before I've used it. Will be back soon with an update.

author: Alexander Ramos Jardim
comment: Amazing app! Runs flawless. Trainer instructions are easy to follow. The program goes from very easy to the real 5k in 30 minutes thing. Buuuuut, I miss Google Fit integration. This is the reason I don't give it 5 stars.

author: Jesse Thibodeau
comment: Really helpful for building endurance even if you haven't had to run since high school 20 years ago.

author: Andy McDade
comment: Says it's 'enhanced for Android Wear' but appears to have no Android Wear' component at all. Can't find a companion app on the wear app store either.

author: Solange Andrade
comment: This app helps a lot with begginers because it is very progresive and you will build up after each run. Good App

author: paul bowen
comment: Useful to get you started without injuring yourself as it will build up your running slowly until you can run 5K unaided also great if like me you haven't run for several months and want to get back into it.

author: madhuri bhadriraju
comment: This doesn't mention it's a paid app after 4 runs I was w2d2 and paid option popped up atleast give a warning before we download this and start the process so that we know.. Now I'll have to begin again in another program 👎

author: A Mathis
comment: This app is free to download, but you have to buy in order to use for more than a few sessions.

author: Rozie Salazar
comment: Works great! Definitely helping me pace myself so that I don't injure myself and the motivating comments are actually helpful.

author: DariNYC
comment: I'm training for boot camp, I leave in a few months and I'm HORRIBLE when it comes to Cardio, never seriously ran before but this app is really useful in planning out the miles as well as the days and the little motivation it gives you in between the runs is perfect for me.

author: Justine Pollitt
comment: I like this app but I want to be able to change the voice to, like  a deep male voice saying like "that's it baby girl, doing so gooood"

author: Jennifer Hollars
comment: I have not ran in 20 years.  I have been using this app to be able to run a 5k at the end of Dec.  It has helped tremendously!

author: Leonardo Kemp
comment: Not free only but free to try, would have preferred to know that before investing my time in this app.

author: Rosie Haste
comment: Love this app. I am the least capable of running but this app has got me doing it. I love the in app voice coach being encouraging and I love playing my music whilst I'm running. The little badges you get motivate me too. I'm doing this. Excellent app!

author: Kiah Raven
comment: Amazing app, it runs smooth, I don't use any other 5k program but this one and it helps rebuild my running if I haven't ran in months. 5 stars!

author: Tyler Frye
comment: Tbis app is what gets me going and running. Helping me change my life to be healthy and happy. Thank you so much!
So far, it's been great! I know I'll have to pay along the way, but it's great to open this app and know when to run and when to walk. I'd recommend it to anyone who is training for their first 5k.

author: Louisa Coles
comment: Occasional glitches when app freezes or seems to jump on a stage, but overall pretty good: does the job simply and clearly with minimum fuss.

author: Haidee Osborne
comment: Awesome app! Worth the extra couple of dollars to upgrade. Definitely buying the 10k once I'm finished with the 5k!

author: Mr. G
comment: You want me to pay to be told to walk and run? I don't think so.

author: Jon Preedy
comment: Distance tracking with GPS log, unobtrusive ads, good program and workout feedback... This one is a good one
Perfect for starting off, the motivational comments always help! Even if it tell me I'm a great runner after my first run :)

author: Gemma Mendham
comment: Does the job. Easing myself back into running and this is bite sized runs and walks

author: Sonya Yi
comment: Great customer service. Helps to have some structure if you're just starting to run!

author: Pete Palmerson
comment: Great.... doable for an out of shape POS like me
